primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The liberation of the human will from the bondage of Sin and Death by an external 'Other Power' (God/Spirit), enabling the person to participate in God's pre-ordained purpose.

subject.identificatie: God / The Spirit of Life / 'Some other point of power'
tekstueel_bewijs: God is at work in you, both to will and to work
The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free
Aid has come to us from 'some other point of power'
set me free from the law of sin and death
delivered from the rhetoric of his passions
bring them by Christ to everlasting salvation
God’s everlasting purpose before the foundation of the world
decreed ... to deliver from curse and damnation

ontvanger.identificatie: The Believer / The Hearer / Frodo / Ransom
tekstueel_bewijs: those whom he hath chosen in Christ
it does indeed seem like 'sweet, pleasant and unspeakable comfort' to me
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver of an action they cannot perform themselves.

tekstueel_bewijs: by the grace of God recognize that you... are unable to change yourself
in Christ there is a new will
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper through whom the Subject acts.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that 'sets free' the internal mechanism of the will.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Death / The Ring / The Dark Lord / The Iron Will
tekstueel_bewijs: The enemy held my will, and he made a chain of it
a fierce eager will was there... it leaped towards him
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an active, predatory power ('fierce eager will') that enslaves the subject, rendering human effort ('iron will') useless.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical life: The freed person performing good works.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Freed Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Good works (visiting prisons, forgiving spouses, etc.)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical program is explicitly a consequence of the soteriological program. 'Then truly, you can do great things... because God is working his purpose out.'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → The Liberation of the Human Will

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is at work in you
The Spirit of life... has set me free
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I do not do what I want

voorbeelden: I will do what I must
I do not do what I want
God is at work in you, both to will...
I do not understand my own actions
unable to change yourself by yourself
you can do great things... because God is working

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (Power) and the gift of 'Vouloir' (Will) and 'Pouvoir' by God. It moves from 'I cannot' to 'God can'.

primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s2: Moralism (God helps those who help themselves)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the illusion of Free Will (~S1) to the reality of Bondage (S2), then to the 'Other Power' of Grace (S1), which redefines Freedom as Predestination.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The paradox that 'Predestination and freedom were apparently identical.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Sin is a 'fierce eager will' that makes a chain of the human will.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon systematically deconstructs human agency as the primary driver of salvation and replaces it with God's sovereign action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; the sermon explicitly attacks 'God helps those who help themselves.'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free.
Sin and Death decide things for us. We have no will left in the matter.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Frodo is not used as a moral example to follow, but as a narrative actant who experiences the same bondage and external rescue as the hearer.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God saves Frodo/Paul, and God saves you.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, 'unspeakable comfort', and empowerment for service.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification: God works the 'will' and the 'doing'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (salvation) to the secondary (ethics) is perfectly handled via Philippians 2:12-13.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The 'Other Power' overcoming the 'Fierce Eager Will' of the Dark Lord/Sin.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) that the human subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity of the will ('no will left in the matter').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by using Frodo as a mirror of human helplessness rather than a hero of human effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this imbalance is theologically intentional to counter American 'Free Will' moralism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a rare example of structural grace. It uses a popular culture reference not to distract, but to illuminate the deep semiotic struggle between the bondage of the will and the liberation of the Spirit.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the LOTR illustrations; Greimas shows that the LOTR characters are actually functional actants for the Spirit's work.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 7; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' actually moves the hearer from the position of 'Opponent' to 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Free Will' debate is actually a conflict between two different 'Senders' (The Self vs. God).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Rutledge Rule' by making God the subject of the transformative verbs.
